info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued March 28 at 9:14AM PDT until March 29 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE BOND, APPLE AND EL DORADO BURN SCAR IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Bond, Apple and El Dorado burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the Bond, Apple, and El Dorado burn scars * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Bond, Apple and El Dorado burn scar is possible up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Bond, Apple and El Dorado burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
